titleInfo.title: Bayou Lafourche Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: Richard Thomas Gibbens Robichaux oral history interview, 2010

name.description: R. Gibbens Robichaux was born in 1930 in Thibodaux, Louisiana, son of Alfred G. Robichaux, Sr. and Sara Day Gibbens Robichaux. He had one brother, Alfred G. Robichaux, Jr. (ca. 1928-2012) and was raised in Thibodaux, growing up in a house across the street from his grandparents (Eugene Godfrey Robichaux and Brigeitte Emma Thibodaux Robichaux) and a few blocks from Bayou Lafourche. He attended parochial school; first Mt. Carmel Convent Academy (now the Carmel Inn), and then Brothers of the Sacred Heart School, from which he graduated at sixteen. He met his future wife, Joann, as a teenager. He attended Spring Hill College in Mobile, Alabama (his father is also an alumnus); both he and his dad played piano and had bands in college. Robichaux enlisted in the US Air Force and was stationed for twenty-five months in Okinawa, Japan, where he was a chaplain's assistant and learned to play the organ. He returned to the States, married his wife, and was stationed in Marietta, Georgia. After he returned to Thibodaux he taught briefly (seventh grade), then worked for the welfare office, before becoming the organist of St. Joseph Co-Cathedral in Thibodaux, where he worked for twenty years. He is still involved in the church and music communities in his retirement. He has written a number of children's books, wrote a regular column for the Thibodaux Chamber of Commerce newsletter, and has released three CDs of music.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by interviewer and interviewee in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.
